poem:
Title: "The Unquiet Sky"

In Damascus' heart, shattered by strife,
Fallen stand the guardians of life.
With the tolling bells of Western winds,
The dance of death invariably begins.
Yet in each dying ember's glow,
Is a tale of humanity unsowed.
Bound, we are, by this earthly realm,
With hurt and hostility at the helm.
Look skyward, amongst the silent stars:
True peace is never very far.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Damascus strike – four Iranian Revolutionary Guards confirmed dead 10.47am GMT Four Iranian Revolutionary Guards confirmed killed in Damascus airstrike Iran has confirmed that four members of its Revolutionary Guards have been killed in Saturday’s missile strike on Damascus. Several members of Syrian armed forces were also killed, Iran’s Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) said in a statement, reported by Al Jazeera: Once more the criminal Zionist regime has moved to violate". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
